metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1855 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in xgene_hwmon_remove indrivers/hwmon/xgene-hwmon.c in the Hardware Monitoring Linux Kernel Driver(xgene-hwmon). This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash the systemdue to a race problem. This vulnerability could even lead to a kernelinformation leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
